concepts: Software testing is the process of evaluating and verifying that a software application works as expected
Testing helps identify bugs, gaps, or missing requirements versus actual requirements
Main objectives include verification, validation, and defect detection
Testing can be manual or automated depending on project requirements
Unit testing focuses on individual components or modules
Integration testing verifies interfaces between components
System testing evaluates complete integrated system
Acceptance testing validates system meets business requirements
Black box testing examines functionality without internal structure knowledge
White box testing requires knowledge of internal code structure
Test cases should cover normal, boundary, and error conditions
Equivalence partitioning divides input data into valid and invalid partitions
